title: R2 Vigilance Check Gate Artifact (V0)
description: Artifact produced when Gate V0 (R2 Vigilance) completes. The SFI protocol injects seeded faults into the evidence; R2 must catch them. Gate PASS requires RMS >= 0.80 (non-EQUIV faults) AND FAR <= 0.10. Maximum 3 attempts before ESCALATE to human.

review_id.description: Unique identifier for this vigilance review session

seeded_faults.description: Array of faults injected by the SFI protocol. Each fault tracks whether R2 caught it and its equivalence status.

real_claims_count.description: Total number of real (non-seeded) claims in the review scope. Used as denominator for FAR.

false_accusations.description: Number of real claims incorrectly flagged as faulty by R2. Numerator for FAR.

metrics.description: Computed RMS and FAR metrics with pass/fail verdicts

gate_result.description: PASS if RMS >= 0.80 AND FAR <= 0.10 and all non-EQUIV faults caught. FAIL otherwise.

v0_attempt_number.description: Current attempt number (1-3). Reaching attempt 3 with FAIL triggers ESCALATE to human.

checked_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when this vigilance check was performed

fault_id.description: Seeded Fault Injection identifier (e.g. SFI-01a, SFI-12c)

category.description: Fault category (e.g. citation_fabrication, stat_manipulation, causal_overclaim, data_misreport)

difficulty.description: Expected difficulty of detecting this seeded fault

caught.description: Whether R2 successfully identified this seeded fault

equivalence_status.description: DISCRIMINABLE faults count toward RMS. EQUIV faults are non-discriminable and excluded from the RMS denominator.

r2_flag_text.description: The text R2 produced when flagging this fault. Null if the fault was not caught.

rms.description: Review Miss Score = faults_caught / faults_injected, computed only over DISCRIMINABLE faults (EQUIV excluded from denominator)
